Creating a CCC for the 21st Century would put Americans to work in the stewardship of our natural resources, revive America‚Äôs natural landscape, and enrich the lives of millions of people across the United States. Now let‚Äôs get to work!

Today, the U.S. is facing major environmental crises from deforestation, pollution, loss of biodiversity, and climate change. With recent attacks on our environment, we must remember we don't have to choose between protecting our natural treasures & creating jobs. We can do both.

From 1933 to 1942, the CCC employed over 3 million Americans, planted 3.5 billion trees, built countless miles of public trails and roadways, and constructed over 800 parks that Americans enjoy to this day.

This week, I introduced the 21st Century Civilian Conservation Corps Act, legislation to reestablish and build upon the historic achievements of the original Civilian Conservation Corps. pic.twitter.com/CPBtzV7rrl
